column1: Gayle and I would like to wish everyone a Happy Thanksgiving! I hope everyone enjoys a safe and wonderful Thanksgiving holiday with their family and friends. #Thankful
Today our nation honors all the valiant and fearless Veterans who have fought for America. We would not be the country we are today without their bravery. THANK YOU and Happy #VeteransDay2020.
Congratulations to Mississippi's own Miss USA Asya Branch! Mississippi is proud to have you represent our amazing state! #MissUSA2020 #MissUSA https://t.co/3NzmGRBvJs

A fundamental principle to our country is ensuring all legal ballots are counted. Please encourage anyone you know who has had first-hand experience of voting fraud to submit their statement using this link: https://t.co/LkxLutSLfV

Great turn out at the polls today! Waited in line for a little less than an hour but it was well worth the wait. A big thank you to our wonderful poll workers. Make sure you go out and vote!  It was also so great bumping into State Rep @shaneag91 https://t.co/bze7tNqcGO
Sock it to the Left and go out and vote RED! #ElectionDay2020 #Election2020  #Vote2020 https://t.co/ecNUJFblER
Tomorrow is the most consequential election of my lifetime. Working hard to re-elect @realDonaldTrump  and @cindyhydesmith. Please get out and vote tomorrow! https://t.co/QF5ieLQc7q

Congratulations to the honorable Amy Coney Barrett for being confirmed as the newest Associate Justice to the Supreme Court of the United States. I hope she has a long and successful tenure on our nation’s highest court!

Big tech companies are helping the Left cover-up @JoeBiden and Hunter Biden’s dirty dealings with China. They are hiding information from the American people to make sure lying Joe gets elected. We must hold these companies accountable.
Sad to see my colleagues on the Left would rather play political games than show up to work and get the job done. #ConfirmACB

I am excited to watch @realDonaldTrump and @JoeBiden  debate tonight. With only 35 days until the elections I hope Joe Biden tries to give some explanation on how he plans to lead our nation. #Debates2020
As we honor and mourn the victims of the 9/11 attacks let us also pray for our troops and first responders who continue to defend America and the freedoms we cherish. https://t.co/IhYfs0ciUU

Americans have come to enjoy Japanese products from high-tech electronics to sushi and Japanese consumers spend billions of dollars each year purchasing American oil medical equipment and computers. Our two countries even forged a bond over baseball America’s pastime. https://t.co/bGGREMS71c

To this day Japan hosts more than 54000 U.S. military personnel and their families. These forces have helped maintain stability in the region and countered threats from China and North Korea – keeping conflict far from American shores. https://t.co/05whZtmpSw
Over the last four months 10.6 million jobs have been added back to the American economy. The Great American Comeback continues! https://t.co/R2Tz2qtmwi

A number of schools have already taken decisive action to place students and teachers in quarantine if they have been exposed to the coronavirus. These decisions are helping to protect the wider community and should be commended. https://t.co/imL4Es1cVp

School districts have had to make tough decisions about when and how to reopen in light of the pandemic. Many are resuming lessons in person while following health guidelines. Others are taking a gradual approach starting with online learning or part-time classroom instruction. https://t.co/sAPwF1c2B8

Recently a pair of House Democrats called on the FBI to investigate Postmaster General Louis DeJoy alleging that he is intentionally slowing down mail deliveries in an effort to affect mail ballots in the November election. This theory has no basis in fact. https://t.co/8dVtpk8U6L
Vote to #KAG this November! https://t.co/bziuV2NxjH
I couldn’t agree more @SpencerMRitchie ! https://t.co/DnItKcc2yk

In testimony before the Senate Homeland Security Committee on Friday Postmaster General Louis DeJoy said he expects ballots to make up less than 2% of mail volume from mid-September to Election Day – hardly a burden for the Postal Service. https://t.co/s59NCGWhgF
November 3rd is right around the corner. Sound off if you're voting to re-elect President @realDonaldTrump! https://t.co/lBQvZwLIhe
Congratulations to President @realDonaldTrump and Vice President @Mike_Pence! I'm looking forward to casting my vote for both of you this November. https://t.co/acz45Ykfh6
These lawless acts have no place in a civilized society and need to be dealt with swiftly. Tolerating this behavior will only lead to more mayhem and injustice. https://t.co/sLGRmaMb7S

Unfortunately a growing number of politicians are working to defund the police and undermine law enforcement. This idea is absurd and Americans know it – polls show that 73% of the country is against cutting funds for police. https://t.co/Ax28MIBE7F
As we near the 2020 election Americans have real concerns about whether online platforms will treat campaigns on both sides of the aisle fairly and equally. https://t.co/V1AiS2JLnQ

According to a 2018 Pew study seven out of 10 Americans believe social media platforms censor political viewpoints that they find objectionable. These concerns are all the more weighty given the immense power that these corporations wield in our society. https://t.co/OHRyFIOo6w
This welcome news comes one day after Kamala Harris said our country was "in tatters." President @realDonaldTrump is leading us in the Great American Comeback. https://t.co/dtYnImahfg

Through national service programs state officials are able to direct resources to match local needs. These projects invest in citizens rather than government and the value to communities far surpasses the cost to taxpayers. https://t.co/1DeGzEqYQS

I introduced the CORPS Act to authorize a significant expansion of national service opportunities. This legislation would help meet specific community needs and save taxpayer dollars as we seek to recover from the pandemic. https://t.co/kBWtLdlkrD

The Chinese Communist Party recently passed a law ending fundamental political freedoms in Hong Kong and it has continued the detestable abuse of the Uighur minority group. Beijing is wasting no time advancing its agenda while the world is distracted by the coronavirus. https://t.co/5jjNhCepFo

Our military has an essential role to play in containing China’s reach advancing our interests and supporting our allies. I am committed to providing our Armed Forces with the resources they need to fulfill their mission. https://t.co/bO7SA43gCb
T-minus 100 days until we elect @realDonaldTrump for a second term. Mark your calendars. #KAG https://t.co/dscasOVKeS

Restaurants have hemorrhaged more jobs than any other economic sector since the coronavirus came to America. In response to these unprecedented challenges I have introduced the RESTAURANTS Act to bring much-needed relief and certainty to restaurants across our nation. https://t.co/LOuyaOy6Km

Google's choice to build its first U.S. Operations Center in Mississippi is a reflection of our state's talented workforce and forward-thinking economic policies. Thank you for the kind words Merle! https://t.co/kC804ribWZ

When the coronavirus came to America restaurants were the hardest-hit businesses affected by health restrictions. Government mandates forced restaurants to shut their doors for months. Now is a time for us to preserve these establishments in their moment of greatest need. https://t.co/ruQsEulc4J

Last year more than 50 U.S. children died in hot cars and unfortunately this year we have already had several hot car deaths. These tragedies can happen to anyone. Never leave a child alone in the car for any period of time. https://t.co/BUHK6rLxtg

Each summer dozens of American families suffer the heartbreaking loss of a child from heatstroke in hot cars. As we enter the peak of summer parents and caretakers should be aware of these risks and take appropriate precautions. https://t.co/E6DlHqT8A9
As Congress works to finalize this year’s defense bill I am mindful of the support we owe to the men and women who keep us safe. https://t.co/Ia8vycIRlu

This annual legislation authorizes military spending to meet the needs expressed by our top military leaders. As a member of the Armed Services Committee I worked to craft core elements of this legislation and hope it will pass soon. https://t.co/Dd6rqSeoEJ
Today marks the 244th anniversary of the founding of this great nation. Happy Independence Day! https://t.co/IYxXcoNcJT

A major factor in President Trump’s election victory was his promise of appointing solid conservative judges to the federal judiciary. Since he took office the Senate has made historic progress in confirming his nominees vowing to leave no vacancy behind. https://t.co/PhoQJ2IltN

Alexander Hamilton recognized that a judge’s role is to make sure the federal government does not go beyond its limited powers. I too am dedicated to supporting judicial nominees who will protect our Constitution and apply the law in an evenhanded manner. https://t.co/bY4QuLwuQv

Congratulations to Mississippi's own Judge Cory T. Wilson on his historic confirmation to the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals. Judge Wilson is the 200th federal judge confirmed under President Trump's leadership - an incredible feat! https://t.co/ouDZLDensH

To help ensure our space economy remains unrivaled I recently joined several colleagues in introducing the American Space Commerce Act of 2020 which would provide incentives for space companies to keep investing in America and to launch from U.S. soil. https://t.co/ybw6KbULI2

The race for space has changed significantly since Neil Armstrong planted the American flag on the face of the moon. If anything the stakes are now higher. I am glad America has returned to manned spaceflight at this pivotal moment in history. https://t.co/btXUK868jO
Happy birthday @realDonaldTrump! I'm proud to work alongside you to #KAG! https://t.co/pmk3Hlwt3I

These National Guardsmen are not only protecting our capital. They are showing that character sacrifice and love of country will outlast the pain and suffering that our nation has recently endured. https://t.co/3aXo98AGKs

These volunteers deserve high praise for their swift response. At noon on Monday they received word from Mississippi’s Adjutant General Durr Boyles. By Wednesday afternoon our guardsmen were carrying out missions bringing calm to a city on edge. https://t.co/6jBYqYSz2W

As scientists continue their work on a vaccine and testing equipment that will enable us all to return to normal life I remain committed to providing students and schools with the resources they need to persevere through this pandemic. https://t.co/eUhzAxt2Ll

The Class of 2020 represents a new decade of graduates who will serve and lead our society long into the future. We all stand to benefit from the contributions they will make as nurses doctors teachers soldiers business owners and ministers. https://t.co/LXu3FxUBI9
Take a moment this Memorial Day to honor the heroic men and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice so that we may be free. https://t.co/IdkeU3yFsb
As a result of the Chinese Communist Party’s ongoing lies and deception I recently joined several colleagues in introducing the COVID-19 Accountability Act. https://t.co/khBmB0Pp2K

In light of the Chinese Communist Party's handling of COVID-19 its military buildup in the Pacific is particularly troubling. I am committed to ensuring our military remains strong enough to prevent China from dominating other countries in the Pacific region. https://t.co/nwrxa54idj

This week the Senate resumed its consideration of the president’s judicial nominees including two highly qualified Mississippians – Cory Wilson and Kristi Johnson. I hope we will confirm these judges swiftly as we continue to remake the federal judiciary. https://t.co/qQIzZn6bxy
After several weeks spent working from home the Senate has returned to Washington to continue our legislative and committee responsibilities. https://t.co/YNjpby9lcp

I am proud to have cosponsored the COVID-19 Accountability Act. This legislation would authorize the President to take appropriate actions against the Chinese government to ensure similar outbreaks do not happen in the future. https://t.co/Ss73ulM0in
We need to make sure that our privacy is protected and we’re not signing something away unknowingly -- even if it's under the guise of tracking the coronavirus. https://t.co/yIoImSoXW6
I have been extraordinarily blessed to know many incredible mothers throughout my life and I am undoubtedly a better person because of it. Happy Mother's Day to all! https://t.co/CHqw54Chm6

To make this reopening and recovery possible we need a huge expansion of testing. This will allow health-care professionals to diagnose and isolate those who are infected so that the vast majority of Americans can get back to work and resume their social lives safely. https://t.co/wlbD3dzqTz

As our country ramps up testing and private companies race to develop vaccines and effective treatments we can begin returning to normal life while taking precautions to minimize risks. https://t.co/GIbnMOOWD1

It was great to sit down with Gov. Tate Reeves and Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith yesterday to give Mississippians an update on the coronavirus. If we all do our part I am confident that we will overcome this and come back better and stronger than ever before. https://t.co/omnFhLGUv5

As Congress considers new relief measures I will work to include targeted funding to ensure that military suppliers get the stable cash flow and contracts they need to endure the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/nOYK0T0zSE

Our military depends on a steady supply of equipment made by thousands of private companies all across the country. I am determined to make sure these workers and our military supply chain overall do not become casualties of the coronavirus. https://t.co/DRo3JEufXX

The Moon and Venus as spotted from my home in Tupelo last night. A sight to behold! Venus will be at its brightest tonight so if you have the chance don't forget to #lookup and enjoy the #nightsky! https://t.co/4jjMeOab5N

Americans began the year enjoying historic levels of economic growth and prosperity. Then came the coronavirus. Our dedicated workforce has the creativity and determination to help us weather this crisis but they need our prayers today. https://t.co/KwtlQ2xbvU

I'm happy to report that the President and leaders in Congress have come to an agreement for an extension to the Paycheck Protection Program. This additional funding will provide urgently-needed assistance to thousands of businesses throughout Mississippi. https://t.co/5GglJBtQ0j

The happy outcome and heroic work of all involved in the Apollo 13 mission led many to call it NASA’s finest hour. If we pull together and do our part in our nation’s challenge with COVID-19 someday we can look back on 2020 as another of our finest hours. https://t.co/JuW8NauMeo
I am happy to help lead this pro-life effort. Now is not the time to cede any ground in the fight for unborn children.  https://t.co/dgpHZmMSK2

Struggling businesses across the nation now have a critical lifeline in the Paycheck Protection Program. This program authorized by the CARES Act will help businesses keep their workers on payroll during this economic slowdown. https://t.co/Xa16qsvgI7
We must ensure that the relief authorized by the passage of the CARES Act reaches all those affected by this virus -- including the aquaculture industry. https://t.co/pXkIMrxMEO
Happy Easter from my family to yours! https://t.co/NpsCp0rgb9
I want to wish you a joyful and blessed Good Friday! https://t.co/whlPHj2X8C
Yesterday I spoke with WLOX about the federal response so far to the coronavirus crisis. There is more work to do but our efforts are starting to make a difference.   https://t.co/Jv3ALdtgrW
Let us all keep up the good work and do our part to help stop the spread of this virus. https://t.co/iwu30HhpNf

In the midst of an unprecedented global health & economic crisis brought on by the coronavirus pandemic Mississippians from all walks of life have stepped up to meet the needs of our neighbors & communities. Each act large & small reminds us that we are all in this together. https://t.co/rSVDzaL3zi
Thanks to President Trump his Administration and Congress for coming together and acting swiftly economic relief is on the way. https://t.co/Qm1Vl6pOz3

Rural hospitals across the nation are facing an acute financial crisis. Congress has provided the flexibility and funding but now it is time for rapid action to sustain these rural providers. https://t.co/gnlVKnVqJU

Just days ago the Senate unanimously passed a massive relief package to help workers and families in almost every segment of our society including businesses hospitals and non-profits. https://t.co/0R1qWYf87X

This legislation will help workers support hospitals and keep businesses from shutting down. For those who have already lost their job we are also significantly increasing unemployment checks. The House of Representatives should act without delay. https://t.co/7nDSCmstdT

Fact: Many people may have the virus without showing any symptoms. Some may never show symptoms at all and others may appear healthy while unknowingly spreading the virus. That's why it's vital that you follow the @WhiteHouse’s latest guidance: https://t.co/xS2kczhbG3 https://t.co/Ouur0zHpn3

Fact: Anyone can get the virus and people with underlying health conditions can have more severe reactions regardless of their age. Analysis from the @CDCgov shows that 1/5 Americans who have been hospitalized with the virus are b/w 20-44. Learn more at https://t.co/FR8eqSaNnm https://t.co/o8RWkRkugh
America is crying out for this. Financial markets are watching this. Our economy is teetering on the brink. We need to get this done. https://t.co/l2p8mnX40r
The proposed flood control project for Hinds and Rankin counties would protect Mississippians in the capital region for generations to come. https://t.co/qhPu6d3udT

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act represents a significant step toward getting our economy back on track and President Trump was right to ask Congress to pass this bill. https://t.co/3MtQ8xSSfc
After years of delay two much-needed flood control projects may finally be ready to move forward. https://t.co/YDhGltO2tQ
The U.S. is well-prepared to address this challenge and we're working diligently in the Senate to do our part. https://t.co/6qltmyVSWu
Visit the @CDCgov's website below to find more information about mitigating the spread of the coronavirus: https://t.co/FR8eqSaNnm  https://t.co/j9JdgmTV8K
Stopping the spread of the coronavirus is a serious effort and President Trump's recent actions will help. https://t.co/Xs3LLEt0Ui
Americans are right to be concerned about the coronavirus however the U.S. is well-prepared to address this challenge. https://t.co/TxEl2A65Yg

Health experts believe the coronavirus will continue to spread around the world however there is no need to panic. Many of those infected have few if any symptoms and the overwhelming majority of patients recover. https://t.co/mgYH7FatCL
Please make time to get out and vote in today's Republican primary!   Find your polling location here: https://t.co/9YLsAkUNdX https://t.co/MZE2PVxsXo

From the beginning of my time in public office I have worked to advance policies to defend innocent human life. I will continue to do so until as a nation we recognize the inherent dignity of every unborn child. https://t.co/RHhPrWOgUb

Recently I joined with Senate colleagues to consider two bills that would establish basic protections for children born and unborn. Unfortunately Senate Democrats blocked both bills. Despite these setbacks I am confident that the pro-life movement is gaining momentum. https://t.co/aM3lafY0TN
Each of these judges will also serve a lifetime appointment and bring long-awaited stability to our nation’s legal system. https://t.co/CO12QdATiu
Onward! https://t.co/we8ANOt19P

Yesterday I was proud to lead the resolution in the Senate to honor former U.S. Senator from Mississippi Hiram Rhodes 150 years after he was sworn in as the first African-American in Congress.   https://t.co/Vh3zh7MMkB

On February 25 1870 – 150 years ago today – Hiram Rhodes Revels of Mississippi became a United States Senator breaking the color barrier that had been in place since our nation's founding. https://t.co/p2C85IwIID

Forty years ago today the U.S. Men's Olympic Hockey team pulled off the upset of the century by coming from behind to beat the Soviet Union in Lake Placid New York. The momentous event would come to be known as the "Miracle on Ice." https://t.co/ppdygZkHbz
Hiram Rhodes Revels was the embodiment of grace under pressure. I am introducing a resolution to recognize his service as the first African American in Congress. https://t.co/uJr4wOxh9G

In 2017 I introduced and the President signed into law the SHIPS Act which made it the policy of the U.S. to acquire a 355-ship fleet as soon as practicable. Last week I introduced the SHIPS Implementation Act which provides a strategic plan to help the Navy reach its goal. https://t.co/caHCozhgrG

In order to maintain the current U.S.-led balance of power we must provide our fighting forces with the tools they need to get the job done. That's why last week I introduced the SHIPS Implementation Act. https://t.co/NDuA30AReR
Expanding the availability of these programs will give more members of this new generation of leaders the opportunity to learn mature and succeed. https://t.co/6GdRl0RPm3

I introduced a bill in 2018 to expand the availability of JROTC programs to more high schools. That legislation is now expanding opportunities for students and communities across the country. https://t.co/3n7d4GYMIN
109 years ago one of our nation's greatest Presidents was born. I still miss President Reagan! https://t.co/483BRiVUhP
Acquitted for life. https://t.co/o5TurEgtpI
@MattLaslo https://t.co/SSHt7Hlwu1

President Trump's State of the Union was outstanding: ✅ Honored Our Military Heroes ✅ Defended Right to Life ✅ Touted Record Economic Success ✅ Brought the Nation Together #SOTU https://t.co/JAikjoucsg

Working with Mitch McConnell...and his colleagues in the Senate we have recommended 180 new judges to uphold our Constitution as written. This includes Neil Gorsuch and Brett Kavanaugh. -President Donald J. Trump  Senate. Republicans. Deliver. #SOTU https://t.co/cFn4ReNpY8

The Tuskegee Airmen were the first African-American military aviators in the U.S. Armed Forces. Proud of the President for honoring Brigadier General Charles McGee and his service to our nation this evening. #SOTU https://t.co/y0pwAl7D9e
I am also calling upon members of Congress tonight to pass legislation finally banning the late-term abortion of babies.  -President Donald J. Trump #SOTU https://t.co/wTx5bWmrB5

Our roaring economy has for the first time ever given many former prisoners the ability to get a great job and a fresh start. This second chance at life is made possible because we passed landmark justice reform into law.   -President Donald J. Trump #SOTU

We are restoring our nation's manufacturing might... America has now gained 12000 new factories under my administration with thousands of thousands of plants and factories being planned or being built. -President Donald J. Trump #SOTU
Tune in at 8pm tonight to see President Trump deliver his 3rd State of the Union Address! https://t.co/sqCBMSMh7J

No matter who actually wins the Iowa Democratic Caucus tonight the real winner is President @realDonaldTrump. When you compare his record of results with the socialist proposals of the 2020 Democrats it is an easy choice for America! #Trump2020 https://t.co/Yej8gVzMtk
Kudos to the @NFL and @FOXSports for this great video before last night’s Super Bowl. Well done.  https://t.co/Oj6bNIHuVp

The American economy is strong and expanding but new technologies have the potential to create even more opportunities for our country. That's why I'm working with the Trump Administration to prepare America for what we call “Industries of the Future.” https://t.co/FioGh5Qf48
Innovation is key to maintaining America’s status as the world’s strongest economic and military power. https://t.co/FTary3VPdo
Today President @realDonaldTrump officially signed the new USMCA trade agreement! Promises Made. Promises Kept. #USMCAWin https://t.co/5bSgrdsZDW
Check out this interview I did on Friday with @MSyallpolitics giving an update from D.C. on the impeachment trial ⬇️ https://t.co/vg5oRsOc43
Anytime we can take power away from Washington and put it back in the hands of the American people is a good thing! https://t.co/InfpFEMAcu

When the Democrats talk about their radical plans to fix income inequality remember this graph. Low-wage workers are seeing higher wage growth than high-wage workers for the first time in over a decade! https://t.co/7XEWOvaLc6
House Democrats may have allowed an angry mob to hijack our democratic processes but Senate Republicans will stop it. A fair trial begins now. https://t.co/GMho8sAaI2
In 2017 Republicans passed tax cuts President Trump signed them into law and this is what happened... 💸Higher Pay 💼 More Jobs 📈 Booming Economy https://t.co/oghXGDl426

The history of our country has been forged by courageous men and women standing up to do the right thing. Today we remember one of the most important of those people Martin Luther King Jr. #MLKDay https://t.co/nL7P9vljFm
Strong work being done on trade relations with China by President @realdonaldtrump are a big win for American farmers and businesses! https://t.co/MjqIGiytYQ
